name: Canyonlands National Park
description: Canyonlands invites you to explore a wilderness of countless canyons and fantastically formed buttes carved by the Colorado River and its tributaries. Rivers divide the park into four districts: Island in the Sky, The Needles, The Maze, and the rivers themselves. These areas share a primitive desert atmosphere, but each offers different opportunities for sightseeing and adventure.
shortDescription: Canyonlands invites you to explore a wilderness of countless canyons and fantastically formed buttes carved by the Colorado River and its tributaries. Rivers divide the park into four districts: Islan...

address.line1: Island in the Sky - 33 miles from Moab on UT 313
address.line2: The Needles - 49 miles from Monticello on UT 211

operatingHours.description: Canyonlands National Park is generally open 24 hours a day, year-round.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: Admits one private, non-commercial vehicle (15 passenger capacity or less) and all its occupants.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Admits one individual with no car. Typically used for bicyclists, hikers, and pedestrians. Youth 15 and under are admitted free.

climate.weatherDescription: Canyonlands is part of the Colorado Plateau, a "high desert" region that experiences wide temperature fluctuations, sometimes over 40 degrees in a single day. The temperate (and most popular) seasons are spring (April-May) and fall (mid-September-October), when daytime highs average 60 to 80 F and lows average 30 to 50 F. Summer temperatures often exceed 100 F, making strenuous exercise difficult. Winters are cold, with highs averaging 30 to 50 F, and lows averaging 0 to 20 F.

images.title: Mesa Arch
images.altText: a broad stone arch with rock pinnacles in the distance
images.caption: Mesa Arch, at Island in the Sky, is a great spot for photographers.

images.title: Pothole Point
images.altText: shallow pools with a double rainbow in the background
images.caption: Pothole Point Trail

images.title: The Maze
images.caption: The Maze is the most remote district of the park. Visiting requires four-wheel drive, self-reliance, and extra time.

images.title: White Rim Road
images.altText: a long gravel road with cyclists on it
images.caption: The White Rim Road at Island in the Sky is a popular road for mountain bikers.

images.title: The Needles in Chesler Park
images.caption: The Needles, pinnacles of Cedar Mesa Sandstone, are visible in many parts of the Needles District, including this view in Chesler Park.

images.title: Boating on the Colorado River
images.altText: a person rowing a dory on the Colorado River
images.caption: Boating the Colorado and Green rivers is a popular activity at Canyonlands (permit required).
